ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Respondent
Is work fun?
Does work make you feel like crying?
Do you wish you didn't have to go to work?
Are you happy when you're at work?
Would you like it if your employer let you stay home from work?
Do you hate work?
Do you like being at work?
Do you like to come to work?
Do you wish you could stay home from work?
Is work a fun place to be?
When you get up in the morning, do you feel happy about  going to work?
Is work unpleasant or awful?
Do you feel happier when it's time to go home from work?
Do you ask your employer to let you stay home from work?
Enjoys work-related activities or events.
Looks forward to going to work.
Talks about work in a negative way.
Tells me about good things that have happened at work.
Tells me about work events that he/she thinks are funny or humorous.
Makes up reasons to stay home from work.
Seems to dread going to work.
Becomes upset when it's time to go to work.
Asks to stay home from work.
Complains about going to work.
